business.headline: Sensex opens 205 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 208.31 points to 80,775.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 24,760.80 as of 9:30 am.

WeWork India IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPFounded in 2016, WeWork India is a flexible workspace operator offering a wide range of solutions including co-working spaces, managed offices, enterprise office suites, private offices, and hybrid digital solutions.

OpenAI hits $500 billion mark as SoftBank, others buy shares: ReportThe latest valuation marks a sharp rise from the company's previous valuation of $300 billion and highlights how quickly OpenAI's value has grown as demand for artificial intelligence tools continues to rise.

Bribes and social media war: Import firm vs Chennai Customs over 'corruption'The controversy began on the social media platform X where Wintrack Inc, a Chennai-based import company, accused Chennai Customs of systemic corruption, saying that constant demands for bribes had forced it to shut down its operations.

Google layoffs: Over 100 design jobs cut in AI shiftGoogle has also been cutting back on management layers. According to reports, the company has reduced the number of middle managers by more than a third, particularly those overseeing small teams.

Market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open on Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra on October 2?Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained its neutral stance.

Satya Nadella bets big on AI, names Judson Althoff to lead Microsoft commercial unitMicrosoft has elevated Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff as CEO of its commercial business, allowing Satya Nadella to focus on AI, datacenter buildout, and product innovation.
Why the price of gold keeps breaking recordsBullion has soared more than 45% this year, putting it on track for the biggest annual gain since 1979.

Adar Poonawalla in talks to buy RCB stake? United Spirits shares updateThe CEO of Serum Institute, Adar Poonawalla, is in talks with Diageo to purchase a stake in RCB, one of the Indian Premier League's top teams.
Are festive cheer and auto stocks driving the market rally?The stock market showed renewed strength, as festive season cheer and gains in auto stocks lifted investor sentiment across sectors.

DA hiked to 58%: What it means for government employees' salary and pensionThe Union Cabinet approved the proposal to increase the DA for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners by 3%. With this revision, the DA rate now stands at 58%.
Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Tata Motors up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 715.64 points to end at 80,983.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 225.20 points to close at 24,836.30.

entertainment.headline: Sharvari begins shooting for Imtiaz Ali's next, wishes Dussehra with special note Bollywood actor Sharvari has begun shooting her next film with acclaimed director Imtiaz Ali, co-starring Vedang Raina, marking the start of the project on Dussehra with a special puja.

Taylor Swift releases new album The Life of a Showgirl, Spotify crashes Spotify experienced a surge in user activity following Taylor Swift's 'The Life of a Showgirl' album release, leading to app crashes. Over 1,000 users reported issues, highlighting the significant demand for the pop star's latest work.

Cinematic thunderstorm: Prabhas, Sandeep Vanga shower praise on Kantara Chapter 1 Actor Prabhas and director Sandeep Reddy Vanga were blown away by Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. While Prabhas called the film brilliant, Sandeep praised the film as a cinematic thunderstorm.

Pawan Kalyan announces plans for OG prequel and sequel after film's success Pawan Kalyan formally announced the plans for a sequel and prequel to 'They Call Him OG' at the film's success meet. The film's strong box office performance motivates continued work on the 'OG' franchise.

Sunny Sanskari box office Day 1: How much did Varun-Janhvi film make? Read here 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor opened to Rs 9.25 crore on its first day amid stiff competition from 'Kantara Chapter 1'.

Rani Mukerji says her mother asked producer to drop her from debut: Don't take her Rani Mukerji reflected on her early struggles in joining films, sharing how her father was against her acting career and her mother even doubted her first screen test. Now a National Award winner, she believes acting has become a far more feasible and respected career option for today's youngsters.

Rishab Shetty recalls inspiring journey: 1 show in 2016 to 5,000 Kantara shows Rishab Shetty recalled his inspiring journey from a struggling director to one of Kannada cinema's celebrated actor-directors. His film 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has achieved over 5,000 houseful shows, marking a major milestone in his career.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 1: Rs 60-crore opening, trails KGF 2 in Hindi Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' collected Rs 60 crore nett in India on its opening day. The film started on a slow note and picked up pace during the evening and night shows.

Ashutosh Rana says Raavan is the worst villain till date Actor Ashutosh Rana, known for playing versatile characters, recently expressed his views on Lord Ram, Raavan, Lord Krishna and spirituality, in an exclusive interview with India Today.

Ashutosh Rana wants to invite this Ramayana character to lunch for this reason Actor Ashutosh Rana, in an exclusive interview with India Today, expressed his views on spirituality, Lord Ram, Raavan and the power of manifestation.

Farah Khan shares pics with Bollywood villains, reveals fun fact about Gafoor song Director Farah Khan recently shared pictures with Bollywood villains and revealed an interesting fact about the popular song 'Gafoor' from Aryan Khan's directorial 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood.'

Alia shares reason for marrying Ranbir, remembers his meeting with her father On 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle', actor Alia Bhatt opened up about why she chose Ranbir Kapoor as her husband. She also recalled how Ranbir's first meeting with her father, Mahesh Bhatt, was an important step and brought her family's blessing.

Mrunal Thakur gets teary eyed as she hugs Priyanka Chopra at Mumbai event. Watch Actor Mrunal Thakur was emotionally overwhelmed at a Mumbai event after she hugged Priyanka Chopra. The interaction between the two actors received an emotional reaction from fans.

Ajith Kumar on how he finds balance between films and passion for racing Actor Ajith Kumar recently got candid about struggling between work and his passion. He even reflected on highlighting Indian cinema on a global platform.

Mookuthi Amman 2: Nayanthara's first look as goddess unveiled on Dussehra The first look of 'Mookuthi Amman 2' was unveiled on Vijayadasami featuring actor Nayanthara as the goddess. The sequel promises a grand visual spectacle with a significant pan-India release and a Rs 100 crore budget.

Exclusive: Awez Darbar vows to never work with Amaal Mallik again After his eviction, influencer Awez Darbar reacted to co-contestant Amaal Mallik's claim of giving him work. In an exclusive interview, he also responded to a question on whether he thinks host Salman Khan is biased towards the singer.

Bigg Boss 19: Is Neelam Giri married? Viral photos spark speculation Viral photos of Bhojpuri actor Neelam Giri, who is currently in 'Bigg Boss 19,' have sparked marriage rumours. Is she married? Who is her husband? Find out all the answers here.

The Game You Never Play Alone review: Promising thriller falters in executionRelease Date:Thu Oct 02, 2025 The Game: You never Play Alone series review: Director Rajesh M Selva's 'The Game: You Never Play Alone' is a thriller set in the world of gaming and cybersecurity. The Netflix show has promising ideas, but fails to explore them fully.

Exclusive: Lovely Runner PD talks Byeon Woo-seok's casting, Indian remake and more Lovely Runner has taken the world by storm, becoming one of the defining K-dramas of 2024 with its unique blend of romance and fantasy. The series' success in India highlights the growing cultural exchange and promising collaboration prospects between Korean and Indian entertainment industries.

general news.headline: India won't accept humiliation: Putin slams US, backs PM Modi on Russian oil tradeVladimir Putin said India would not bow to foreign pressure, declaring, "India will never allow itself to be humiliated," and adding that Prime Minister Narendra Modi would not take such a step.

This player is from Azad...: Pak's Sana Mir clarifies after massive backlashPakistani commentator Sana Mir has clarified her usage of the phrase "Azad Kashmir" while referring to a cricketer from Pakistan-occupied Kashmir during a Women's World Cup match.

Dutch chip firm executive slams EU leaders, praises PM's communication strategiesFrank Heemskerk, a top executive at the Dutch semiconductor giant ASML, made the remarks at a business event in Brussels when he was asked if his company had easy access to European leaders.

Day 2 Live: India take lead, Shubman nears fiftyIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI) Live Score, 1st Test, Day 2: India have taken the lead in the 1st innings. KL Rahul and Shubman Gill have helped India go past Windies in the first session of Day 2 itself.

Taylor Swift releases new album The Life of a Showgirl, Spotify crashesSpotify experienced a surge in user activity following Taylor Swift's 'The Life of a Showgirl' album release, leading to app crashes. Over 1,000 users reported issues, highlighting the significant demand for the pop star's latest work.

Apple Watch Ultra saves life of 26-year-old Mumbai techie after scuba diving accidentThe robust health and environment tracking in devices like Apple Watch can prove to be life-saving. As the Apple Watch Ultra recently did in the case of Kshitij Zodape, a Mumbai resident who was scuba diving in Puducherry a few months ago.

Madhya Pradesh: Kidney failure children deaths rise to 9, cough syrup under scannerNine children have died in Chhindwara following kidney failure, with many reportedly having consumed contaminated cough syrup. State health agencies have launched investigations and imposed bans amid ongoing monitoring and testing.

Police storm Islamabad press club, assault journalists as POK anger boils overThe unrest in POK spilled on to the Pakistani capital as protests reached Islamabad, inviting a crackdown by police. Visuals showed police assaulting journalists with batons and destroying media equipment.

Watch: EU leaders mock Trump's Armenia gaffe on hot mic, Macron can't stop laughingAlbanian Prime Minister Edi Rama took a dig at Trump, who on repeated occasions has mixed up Armenia with Albania while speaking about the peace deal he brokered with Azerbaijan.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Sonam Wangchuk's wife approaches Supreme Court over his arrest in Ladakh protestGitanjali Angmo has approached the Supreme Court challenging husband Sonam Wangchuk's arrest and demanding his immediate release.

Canadian theatre halts screening Indian films after two violent attacksThe first incident occurred on September 25, when two suspects attempted to set fire to the theatre's entrance, while the second attack on Thursday 2 occurred when a single suspect fired multiple gunshots through the cinema hall's entrance doors.

World Weightlifting Championships: Olympic medalist Mirabai Chanu wins silverIndia's Mirabai Chanu returned to the World Weightlifting Championships podium with a silver in the women's 48kg, recording her first world medal since 2022, as North Korea's Ri Song Gum claimed gold with a world record total.

Bandmate, co-singer arrested in Zubeen Garg death case; total arrests rise to 4The CID's probe has expanded rapidly, fuelled by more than 60 FIRs filed across Assam after Garg's sudden death. The 52-year-old singer died in Singapore on September 19 while swimming in the sea. He had travelled there for the festival organised by Mahanta's company.

Man in Hapur dies after alleged poisoning and assault by in-lawsAccording to sources, the incident occurred in Hapur district after a heated disagreement allegedly broke out between the victim, identified as Sonu, and his wife, who complained to her family about it.

Elon Musk led Grok is hiring humans to teach it how to make video gamesElon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI is looking for people who can help its chatbot Grok understand the world of video games. Here are the details.

BJP like an amoeba, causes unrest in society: Uddhav Thackeray at Dussehra rallyAt his annual Dussehra rally, Uddhav Thackeray compared BJP to an amoeba that spreads unrest, accused it of fake Hindutva, and warned of Mumbai's control being handed to corporate houses if BJP wins BMC polls.

JEE, NEET too tough? Centre to review difficulty to reduce coaching relianceThe Centre has set up a nine-member panel to examine the difficulty level of entrance exams like JEE and NEET. The panel will also suggest reforms to reduce student reliance on coaching centres and align exams with the class 12 curriculum.
Breaking Silos: Why India's armed forces must embrace a joint cultureTransforming mindsets remains key to fostering the collective synergy among the three services that modern warfare demands.

His film 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has achieved over 5,000 houseful shows, marking a major milestone in his career.

Being dealt with utmost seriousness: Centre orders probe into Wintrack vs customsThe finance ministry said a senior officer from the Department of Revenue has been deputed to conduct a detailed factual probe, which will include hearing all parties concerned, examining officials, and reviewing relevant documentary evidence.

3 women confess they pressured students in harassment case involving Delhi BabaThe three women admitted that they acted on the directions of Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati and pressured women students on the pretext of discipline and punctuality, sources said.

Sir Creek dispute explained: What's behind Rajnath Singh's big warning to Pak?Sir Creek, a 96-km tidal estuary on the India-Pakistan border, is back in focus after Rajnath Singh's big warning to Pakistan over the military build-ups in the area that has long been disputed over maritime boundaries, economic resources, and strategic control.

Namibia and Zimbabwe qualify for ICC Men's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka Namibia and Zimbabwe qualified for next year's ICC Men's T20 World Cup to be held in India and Sri Lanka after reaching the semifinals in the Africa Regional Final in Harare on Thursday.

KL Rahul takes Rohit Sharma's role, become tone-setter for India in Tests After finally finding his place in the Indian Test team, KL Rahul is now ensuring that he sets the tone for his side's innings in each game. Rahul once again showed his class with a gritty fifty against West Indies on Day 1 of the first Test.

1st T20I: Bangladesh survive batting collapse to seal thriller vs Afghanistan Bangladesh survived a stunning collapse to secure a four-wicket victory over Afghanistan in the opening T20I, with Nurul Hasan and Rishad Hossain guiding their side home after Rashid Khan's four-wicket burst threatened to turn the contest on its head.

Nat Sciver-Brunt's England aim for fifth title amid challenging times Women's World Cup Preview: After an Ashes whitewash and a series loss to India, Nat Sciver-Brunt's England are seeking redemption as they chase a fifth title.

Excited to play big teams early, enjoy facing England in World Cups: Wolvaardt South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt said that they don't mind playing big teams early in the Women's World Cup 2025, and they always enjoy facing England in World Cup events. England and South Africa are set to begin their campaign against each other on Friday, October 3 in Guwahati.

Using Bavuma and men as inspiration, Laura Wolvaardt hoping for special World Cup South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt is hoping that her side can use Temba Bavuma and his men's World Test Championship win as inspiration during the Women's World Cup 2025 and secure the title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
